intro: Willoughbya chlorolepis, commonly known as the yellow bell tree, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the branches. Willoughbya chlorolepis is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
